title: Swahili Loanwords in English
description: From safari to jumbo, explore the Swahili words that have journeyed into everyday English!

questions.question: The word 'safari' is commonly associated with Swahili. What does 'safari' mean in Swahili?
Which English word meaning 'large' or 'huge' may derive from the Swahili 'jambo' (meaning 'hello' or 'big')?
The word 'bongo' (a type of drum) has connections to Swahili. Bongo drums are associated with which musical traditions?
Which English word for a type of large African antelope comes from Swahili?
The Swahili word 'simba' (meaning 'lion') became famous through which popular Disney film?
Which Swahili phrase meaning 'no worries' became internationally famous through a Disney song?
The word 'kwanzaa' (the African American holiday) is based on the Swahili phrase 'matunda ya kwanza.' What does it mean?
Which Swahili word meaning 'freedom' was a rallying cry during African independence movements?
The word 'jeep' is debated, but some suggest connections to the Swahili-influenced word for which animal?
Which English word for a type of veranda or porch in East Africa comes from the Swahili 'baraza'?
The Swahili word 'bwana' was used by English speakers in colonial East Africa. What does it mean?
Which word for a type of East African coastal trading vessel comes from Swahili maritime vocabulary?
The Swahili word 'askari' is used in English. What does it mean?
Which Swahili word for 'unity' is one of the seven principles of Kwanzaa?
The word 'Swahili' itself comes from the Arabic 'sawahil.' What does 'sawahil' mean?
